pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:0.5.eng: The training rule on light cloaks

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.3.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo uṇhakāle mahagghaṃ khomaṃ pārupitvā yena thullanandā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.3.eng: On one occasion when the weather was warm, King Pasenadi of Kosala put on an expensive linen cloak and went to Thullanandā. He bowed and sat down.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.4.eng: And Thullanandā instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.5.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.7.pli: “Sace me tvaṃ, mahārāja, dātukāmosi, imaṃ khomaṃ dehī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.7.eng: “Great king, if you wish to give me something, then give me this linen cloak.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.8.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā khomaṃ datvā uṭṭhāyāsanā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.8.eng: The king gave her his cloak. He then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated her with his right side toward her, and left.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.10.eng: “These nuns have great desires; they are not content.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.11.eng: How can they ask the king for his linen cloak?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.12.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.12.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.13.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.13.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.14.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā rājānaṃ khomaṃ viññāpessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.14.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask the king for his linen cloak?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.15.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī rājānaṃ khomaṃ viññāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā asked for this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī rājānaṃ khomaṃ viññāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.18.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā ask the king for his linen cloak?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.21.1.pli: “Lahupāvuraṇaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā cetāpentiyā aḍḍhateyyakaṃsaparamaṃ cetāpetabbaṃ. Tato ce uttari cetāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:1.21.1.eng: ‘If a nun carries out an exchange to get a light cloak, it is to be worth at most two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins. If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.2.eng: whatever cloak is used in warm weather.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.3.eng: Carries out an exchange to get:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.5.eng: It is to be worth at most two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.6.eng: it may be worth ten kahāpaṇa coins.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.7.eng: If she gets one in exchange that is worth more than that:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.8.eng: if she asks for one worth more than that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.9.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.10.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.10.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.11.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.12.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.13.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, lahupāvuraṇaṃ atirekaaḍḍhateyyakaṃsaparamaṃ cetāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.13.eng: ‘Venerables, this light cloak worth more than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, which I got in exchange, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.17.1.eng: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, and she perceives it as such, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.18.eng: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, but she is unsure of it, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.19.eng: If it is worth more than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, but she perceives it as being worth less, and she gets it in exchange, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.20.eng: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, but she perceives it as being worth more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.21.eng: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.1.22.eng: If it is worth less than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.2.eng: if she carries out an exchange for one worth at most two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.3.eng: if she carries out an exchange for one worth less than two-and-a-half kaṁsa coins;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.5.eng: if it is from those who have given an invitation;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.6.eng: if it is for the benefit of someone else;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.7.eng: if it is by means of her own property;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.8.eng: if she gets one in exchange that has little value from someone who wants to exchange one of great value;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.10.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.11.eng: The twelfth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.11.comm: The nuns’ offenses entailing relinquishment 13–30 are identical, except for appropriate gender changes, to the monks’ relinquishment offenses as follows: Bi NP 13–15 = Bu NP 1–3 at Bu NP 1:2.17.1, Bu NP 2:2.39.1, and Bu NP 3:1.3.13.1; Bi NP 16–20 = Bu NP 6–10 at Bu NP 6:2.18.1, Bu NP 7:1.31.1, Bu NP 8:1.1.32.1, Bu NP 9:1.36.1, and Bu NP 10:1.3.1; Bi NP 21–23 = Bu NP 18–20 at Bu NP 18:1.28.1, Bu NP 19:1.15.1, and Bu NP 20:1.35.1; Bi NP 24–25 = Bu NP 22–23 at Bu NP 22:1.3.17.1 and Bu NP 23:1.3.32.1; Bi NP 26–29 = Bu NP 25–28 at Bu NP 25:1.27.1, Bu NP 26:1.23.1, Bu NP 27:1.45.1, and Bu NP 28:1.2.19.1; Bi NP 30 = Bu NP 30 at Bu NP 30:1.27.1.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.14.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.14.eng: “Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.14.comm: Before this summary line, the Pali reads (Dutiya) Pattavagga, “the (second) subchapter on almsbowls”, to indicate the last subchapter of nissaggiya pācittiya rules for the nuns, and then Pariṇatasikkhāpada, “the training rule on diverting an offering intended for the Sangha”, to indicate the last rule in the chapter of nissaggiya pācittiya rules. These indications are redundant in the present translation, since I have just pointed out all the missing rules and their equivalents in the bhikkhu-vibhaṅga.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.15.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.21.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np12:2.2.22.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment in the Nuns’ Analysis is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:0.5.eng: The training rule on distributing out-of-season robe-cloth

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo gāmakāvāse vassaṃvuṭṭhā sāvatthiṃ agamaṃsu vattasampannā iriyāpathasampannā duccoḷā lūkhacīvarā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.2.eng: At that time, after completing the rainy-season residence in a village monastery, a number of nuns were traveling to Sāvatthī. They were perfect in conduct and deportment, but poorly dressed in shabby robes.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.3.eng: Some lay followers who saw them thought,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.4.pli: “imā bhikkhuniyo vattasampannā iriyāpathasampannā duccoḷā lūkhacīvarā, imā bhikkhuniyo acchinnā bhavissantī”ti bhikkhunisaṅghassa akālacīvaraṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.4.eng: “These nuns are perfect in conduct and deportment, but poorly dressed in shabby robes; they must’ve been robbed,” and they gave out-of-season robe-cloth to the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.5.eng: Because they had performed the robe-making ceremony, the nun Thullanandā

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.6.eng: determined it as in-season robe-cloth, and then distributed it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.7.eng: The lay followers asked those nuns whether

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.10.eng: and told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.10.comm: The point here is that because Thullanandā (illegitimately) determines the robe-cloth as in-season, it can only be distributed to those nuns who have spent the rainy season in the monastery where the robe-cloth is given. The traveling nuns were therefore excluded from receiving it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.12.eng: Those lay followers then complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā akālacīvaraṃ ‘kālacīvaran’ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.13.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā determine out-of-season robe-cloth as ‘in-season’, and then distribute it?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.14.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ upāsakānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.14.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those lay followers,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.15.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.15.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.16.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā akālacīvaraṃ ‘kālacīvaran’ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpessatī”ti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.17.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.17.eng: Those nuns then told the monks,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.18.eng: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.19.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī akālacīvaraṃ ‘kālacīvaran’ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpetī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.19.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.22.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī akālacīvaraṃ “kālacīvaran”ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpessati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.22.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.24.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.24.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.25.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī akālacīvaraṃ ‘kālacīvaran’ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:1.25.1.eng: ‘If a nun determines out-of-season robe-cloth as “in-season”, and then distributes it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.6.pli: anatthate kathine ekādasamāse uppannaṃ, atthate kathine sattamāse uppannaṃ, kālepi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.6.eng: for one who has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is robe-cloth given during the eleven months. For one who has participated in the robe-making ceremony, it is robe-cloth given during the seven months. Also, if it is given in the robe season, but the cloth is designated, it is called “out-of-season robe-cloth”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.6.comm: That is, in-season robe-cloth is cloth obtained during the last month of the rainy season, while out-of-season robe-cloth is cloth obtained during the remaining eleven months of the year. See Kkh. | According to the commentary to Bu Np 3, Sp 1.499: Kālepi ādissa dinnanti saṅghassa vā “idaṁ akālacīvara”nti uddisitvā dinnaṁ, ekapuggalassa vā “idaṁ tuyhaṁ dammī”ti dinnaṁ, “‘Also, if it is given in the robe season, but it is designated’ means: it is given to the Sangha after designating it by saying, ‘This is out-of-season robe-cloth’, or it is given to an individual by saying, ‘I give this to you.’” In other words, it is designated as out-of-season cloth or designated to an individual. The commentary to the present rule, at Sp 2.740, adds that designating to a group is included in designated cloth: Ādissa dinnanti sampattā bhājentūti vatvāpi idaṁ gaṇassa idaṁ tumhākaṁ dammīti vatvā vā dātukamyatāya pādamūle ṭhapetvā vā dinnampi ādissa dinnaṁ nāma hoti; etaṁ sabbampi akālacīvaraṁ, “‘Given after designating’ means: if they give after saying, ‘Let those who are present share it out’, or after saying, ‘I give this to the group, to you’, or they place it at the feet (of the recipient) wishing to give, this is called ‘Given after designating’. All this is called out-of-season robe-cloth.” See also kathina in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.7.eng: If she distributes it after determining the out-of-season robe-cloth as “in-season”, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.8.eng: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.9.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.9.eng: The robe-cloth should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.10.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.11.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.12.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, akālacīvaraṃ ‘kālacīvaran’ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.12.eng: … ‘Venerables, this out-of-season robe-cloth, which I distributed after determining it as “in-season”, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.1.15.eng: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.1.pli: Akālacīvare akālacīvarasaññā “kālacīvaran”ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.1.eng: If it is out-of-season robe-cloth and she perceives it as such, and she distributes it after determining it as “in-season”, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.2.pli: Akālacīvare vematikā “kālacīvaran”ti adhiṭṭhahitvā bhājāpeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.2.eng: If it is out-of-season robe-cloth, but she is unsure of it, and she distributes it after determining it as “in-season”, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.3.eng: If it is out-of-season robe-cloth, but she perceives it as in-season robe-cloth, and she distributes it after determining it as “in-season”, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.4.eng: If it is in-season robe-cloth, but she perceives it as out-of-season robe-cloth, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.5.eng: If it is in-season robe-cloth, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.2.6.eng: If it is in-season robe-cloth and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.3.2.eng: if she distributes out-of-season robe-cloth that she perceives as in-season;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.3.3.eng: if she distributes in-season robe-cloth that she perceives as in-season;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np2:2.3.6.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:0.5.eng: The training rule on trading robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī aññatarāya bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā paribhuñji.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was using a robe she had received after trading with another nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.3.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī taṃ cīvaraṃ saṅgharitvā nikkhipi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.3.eng: But the other nun folded up the robe she had received and put it aside.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.5.pli: “yaṃ te, ayye, mayā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattitaṃ, kahaṃ taṃ cīvaran”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.5.eng: “Venerable, where’s that robe that I traded with you?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.6.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī taṃ cīvaraṃ nīharitvā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā dassesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.6.eng: She brought out the robe and showed it to her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.8.pli: “handāyye, tuyhaṃ cīvaraṃ, āhara metaṃ cīvaraṃ, yaṃ tuyhaṃ tuyhamevetaṃ, yaṃ mayhaṃ mayhamevetaṃ, āhara metaṃ, sakaṃ paccāharā”ti acchindi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.8.eng: “Here’s your robe and give me that robe of mine. That which is yours is yours and that which is mine is mine. Give me that and take back what’s yours.” And she just took it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.9.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.9.eng: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.10.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.10.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.11.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā trade a robe with a nun and then take it back?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.12.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.12.eng: Those nuns then told the monks,

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.13.eng: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.17.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā trade a robe with a nun and then take it back?

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.19.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.20.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ parivattetvā sā pacchā evaṃ vadeyya—‘handāyye, tuyhaṃ cīvaraṃ āhara, metaṃ cīvaraṃ, yaṃ tuyhaṃ tuyhamevetaṃ, yaṃ mayhaṃ mayhamevetaṃ, āhara metaṃ, sakaṃ paccāharā’ti acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a nun trades robes with a nun and then says, “Here’s your robe; give me that robe of mine. That which is yours is yours, and that which is mine is mine. Give me that, and take back what’s yours;” and she just takes it or has it taken, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.8.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.8.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.8.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4 the size referred to here is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”. For an explanation of sugata as “standard” and the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.10.pli: parittena vā vipulaṃ, vipulena vā parittaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.10.eng: much with little or little with much.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.12.eng: if she just takes it herself, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.14.eng: if she asks another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.15.pli: Sakiṃ āṇattā bahukampi acchindati, nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.15.eng: If she only asks once, then even if the other takes back many, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.15.comm: “Many” renders bahukaṁ. This is based on the commentary to Bu Np 25, Sp 1.633: Āṇatto bahūni gaṇhāti, ekaṁ pācittiyaṁ, “If the one who is asked takes many, there is (only) one offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.16.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā ekabhikkhuniyā vā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.16.eng: The robe-cloth should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.17.eng: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.18.eng: (To be expanded as in Bi Np 1:2.1.21–Bi Np 1:2.1.43, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.19.pli: “idaṃ me, ayye, cīvaraṃ bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ parivattetvā acchinnaṃ nissaggiyaṃ, imāhaṃ saṅghassa nissajjāmī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.19.eng: … ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth, which I took back after trading it with a nun, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.1.22.eng: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindati vā acchindāpeti vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained and she perceives her as such, and after trading robe-cloth with her she takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindati vā acchindāpeti vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and after trading robe-cloth with her she takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā cīvaraṃ parivattetvā acchindati vā acchindāpeti vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and after trading robe-cloth with her she takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.4.pli: Aññaṃ parikkhāraṃ parivattetvā acchindati vā acchindāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.4.eng: If she trades another requisite, and then takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.5.pli: Anupasampannāya saddhiṃ cīvaraṃ vā aññaṃ vā parikkhāraṃ parivattetvā acchindati vā acchindāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.5.eng: If she trades robe-cloth or another requisite with someone who is not fully ordained, and then takes it back or has it taken back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.2.8.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.2.eng: if the other nun gives it back;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.3.eng: if she takes it on trust from her;

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-np3:2.3.6.eng: The third training rule is finished.
